shade.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: slight darkness or shelter from the direct light of the sun made by something blocking it
shade.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a plant that needs a lot of shade
The temperature was over 90 degrees in the shade.
She was sitting in the shade of a large oak tree.
shade.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: something you use to reduce or block light
shade.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The shade on the lamp was slightly crooked.
shade.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a covering that can be pulled down over a window
shade.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the dark places in a picture
shade.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: strong contrasts of light and shade
shade.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a particular type of red, green, blue etc
shade.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to protect something from direct light
shade.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Shading her eyes, Anita scanned the horizon.
shade.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to make part of a picture or drawing darker
shade.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: She shaded in the circles in the last two letters.
